column1: CALIFORNIANS: a reminder that open enrollment to sign up for health insurance has started and will be available through January 31. With coronavirus cases on the rise it’s crucial everyone has health coverage. Visit https://t.co/YjWXbdQXpX now.
Millions of Americans are out of work struggling to pay their bills and going hungry as we continue to fight COVID-19. We must do everything we can to bring people relief during this difficult time.

During the holidays it’s important we do everything we can to prevent COVID-19 from spreading. That means practicing social distancing washing your hands and wearing a mask—it can save your life and the lives of the people you love.

We’ve surpassed 12.6 million coronavirus cases and have lost more than 260000 lives in the United States. These are tragic milestones—so many have lost loved ones to this deadly virus. Keeping all those hurting in my heart.
Hospitals and health care workers are facing overwhelming surges in coronavirus cases nationwide. Please do your part in slowing the spread. We will defeat this virus but we have to do it together.
COVID-19 doesn’t take a break during the holidays. This virus is still with us. Stay safe this holiday season by continuing to follow CDC guidelines and please—wear a mask.
There’s no question COVID-19 has affected the livelihoods of many – it’s vital we get ahold of this deadly virus so we can save lives and get our economy back on track.

There have been over 12 million coronavirus cases in the United States. For your safety and the safety of those around you please continue to practice social distancing and wear a mask. We will get through this together.
The United States has surpassed 250000 coronavirus deaths. This is devastating– I am keeping all those who’ve lost a loved one to this deadly pandemic in my heart.

Californians spread the word: open enrollment to sign up for health insurance has begun and is available through January 31. While our country continues to fight COVID-19 it’s essential everyone has health coverage. Visit https://t.co/YjWXbdQXpX to get covered now.
As coronavirus cases continue to surge across the country please do your part in stopping the spread—wear a mask.

We need a reliable Federal Reserve to help manage our economy in this pandemic.  Judy Shelton’s dangerous ideas would devastate our economy and her lack of commitment to using the full force of the Fed to provide COVID-19 relief is unacceptable.  I voted no on her nomination.

Thinking about health care workers who have given it their all during this pandemic many of whom are once again facing record hospitalizations as coronavirus cases surge. We must all do our part to reduce the spread of this deadly disease.

As folks make plans for the holidays remember that coronavirus is still with us and we have to maintain social distancing—but that doesn’t mean emotional distancing. Virtually check in on loved ones your single friends and family. No one should be emotionally isolated.

More than 1 million Californians have contracted COVID-19. My heart is with all of those who have been impacted by this deadly disease. Please stay vigilant and do everything possible to prevent further spread.  https://t.co/tuIfzphsNi
Yesterday the United States reported a record number of new coronavirus cases. Doctors and nurses continue to be overwhelmed with all-time high hospitalizations. Please—wear a mask.

9 million coronavirus cases and more than 228000 deaths in America. These are tragic milestones. My heart goes out to the countless people who have been impacted by the loss of a parent grandparent or loved one. May you find strength and healing. https://t.co/Om51K1fyzW
It’s unthinkable that Senate Republicans have left the American people hanging without passing additional COVID-19 relief but instead jammed through Trump judges.
Now is not the time to ease up on the most simple steps you can take to protect yourself from COVID-19. We’re still in this pandemic. Wear a mask—it saves lives.

The American people won’t forget that instead of passing adequate COVID-19 relief legislation to help the American people Senate Republicans worked through the weekend to rush a vote tomorrow to confirm Trump’s Supreme Court nominee.
Coronavirus cases are rising across the country once again overwhelming hospitals and health care workers in certain areas. Wear a mask wash your hands and keep practicing social distancing.
Mitch McConnell has the Senate working through the weekend right now—not to provide COVID-19 relief to people who need it but to jam through a Supreme Court confirmation. This is so out of touch.

Say it with me: the Senate should be passing the House’s COVID-19 relief bill to help the American people not rushing to confirm a Supreme Court justice so they can gut access to health care during a pandemic.

Because of COVID-19 more than 8 million Americans may have a new preexisting condition. If Republicans confirm Trump’s SCOTUS nominee we know what could happen: the Court guts the Affordable Care Act and ends protections for preexisting conditions. #WeDissent
Senate Republicans haven’t lifted a finger in 150 days to consider the House’s COVID-19 relief bill—but they’re determined to rush through a SCOTUS confirmation. https://t.co/lWOe5bO77D

To everyone who is barely hanging onto their homes who has lost a loved one to COVID-19 who has no way to pay the bills: know that instead of voting to provide relief you desperately need Senate Republicans today are choosing to hold a hearing to confirm a judge.

The vast majority of Americans want the Senate to pass additional COVID-19 relief legislation instead of pushing through a Supreme Court confirmation.  Countless Americans are hanging on to their homes by a thread—they must be our priority.
Every member on the Senate Judiciary Committee must be tested for COVID-19 before the Supreme Court confirmation hearings start on Monday.

Today I joined @SenatorLeahy and @SenBooker in demanding that all senators on the Judiciary committee get tested for COVID-19 ahead of the Supreme Court hearings.  This is the bare minimum to ensure the safety of members our staff and the Senate complex employees.

Instead of taking up additional COVID-19 relief legislation that our country so desperately needs the Senate on Monday is holding Supreme Court confirmation hearings. This is entirely out of touch with what the American people are demanding.
Supreme Court confirmation hearings are set to start on Monday—less than two weeks after members on the committee tested positive for COVID-19. This is utterly reckless.
Some basic truths: COVID-19 is much deadlier than the flu. Wearing a mask saves lives. Don’t let up on taking such a simple step to protect yourself and the people you love.
More than 210000 Americans have died from COVID-19. We know this virus is much deadlier than the seasonal flu. Don’t let anyone tell you otherwise.

Don’t let up on wearing a mask practicing social distancing and staying indoors as much as possible. Coronavirus is still with us and devastating our communities. Taking these easy steps could save your life. https://t.co/PQn2DDaKlQ

Nearly 1.1 million coronavirus deaths worldwide including more than 206000 Americans. There’s no question that Congress needs to take up additional measures to address the real pain that continues to be felt across the country.
Coronavirus cases are rising in many states across the country. This deadly virus is still with us—don’t let up on wearing a mask. https://t.co/DK3UTpuGhD

More than 200000 Americans have been killed by the coronavirus. It’s astonishing to have reached such a devastating milestone. I'm thinking about every family that has been hurt so many of whom were unable to be by their loved one in their final moments.

The United States has now surpassed 200000 coronavirus deaths. We’re talking about mothers fathers grandparents—real people who leave behind communities that have been torn apart. We cannot grow numb to how devastating this is.

Coronavirus wildfires and earthquakes. Californians have endured so much in recent weeks but we must stay vigilant as these threats remain ongoing. Wear a mask have a plan in the event of a wildfire or earthquake—stay safe and look out for each other. https://t.co/8m1EagJVw8

Air quality in California remains severely impacted by the wildfires. Do not take this lightly—especially during a pandemic where coronavirus can severely impact your respiratory system. Remember to take steps to protect yourself and check in on loved ones too.
Months after COVID-19 was declared a pandemic the administration is still in court trying to overturn the Affordable Care Act and strip away health insurance from millions of Americans.
Millions are out of work hungry and suffering as the United States has surpassed 194000 coronavirus deaths. The American people desperately need meaningful action from Congress.

Countless families across the country have lost everything during this pandemic and are hanging on to their homes by a thread. Congress must pass additional coronavirus relief legislation for the American people—immediately.

There have been more than 187000 coronavirus deaths nationwide. Keeping all those who have lost family members and friends to this virus in my heart.  We will get through this pandemic. Listen to health care professionals and wear a mask.
As we head into Labor Day weekend it’s vital we remain vigilant to stop the spread of COVID-19. Avoid large crowds mask up and wash your hands. We can beat this virus but we have to do it together.

The United States has surpassed 6 million coronavirus cases.   We have to do our part in slowing down the spread to protect our communities. Listen to public health experts practice social distancing wash your hands and wear a mask.

Last week more than 1 million Americans filed for unemployment benefits—again.  As coronavirus continues to threaten the livelihoods of the American people Congress must bring relief to all those struggling.
There have been over 183000 lives lost to coronavirus in the United States. My heart goes out to all those who have lost a loved one during this pandemic.  Please stay vigilant and wear a mask.
There have been over 5.8 million coronavirus cases in the U.S. alone. Wear a mask wash your hands practice social distancing and save lives.

The United States is approaching 180000 coronavirus deaths. We can all still do our part to prevent more deaths in our communities. Stay vigilant against this virus and let’s keep the families and loved ones of those lost in our hearts.

No matter how hot it gets in California during this heat wave please continue to wear a mask when leaving your home. We can’t let up on that while coronavirus cases continue to rise all around us. https://t.co/zFo3xMAckh

We’ve surpassed 5.2 million coronavirus cases in the United States and 166000 deaths. Thousands have lost family members without being able to say goodbye or stand by their side in their last moments.  And we have more difficult months ahead—Congress needs to do more. Now.

The administration has been expelling migrant children. They said it’s to contain the spread of COVID-19 but these children have tested negative. I’ll say it again– they’re using the pandemic to harm immigrants including unaccompanied children. https://t.co/58mt5HDxFY

Giving birth during a pandemic–specifically one disproportionately impacting people of color–presents challenges especially for Black women. I joined @SenWarren & @RepUnderwood on legislation to ensure maternal care is centered in our COVID-19 response.  https://t.co/b8SZDbQNtq

The executive orders issued by the president over the weekend are weak and inadequate. More than 163000 Americans have died from coronavirus yet the White House & Senate Republicans refuse to work toward a bipartisan bill. Congress must act now.

More than 4.8 million Americans have been infected with COVID-19 and more than 159000 have died. We cannot grow numb to these numbers and the many more lives devastated by these losses.  Look out for one another and please wear a mask.

Today I'm formally introducing the RELIEF Act in Congress to help stop evictions and keep people housed during this crisis.  Few things are more essential right now than housing and running water to prevent the spread of COVID-19.  Read about it here. https://t.co/jmncjbiuOV

Absolutely gut-wrenching. My heart goes out to Hannah Kim and her younger brother.  Coronavirus cases are climbing and we have to remain vigilant. Everyone needs to take this seriously and that means wearing a mask staying home if you can and washing your hands. https://t.co/pV1fzzkbRZ

I sent my first letter to DOJ sounding the alarm against the spread of COVID-19 in prisons way back on March 5. Make no mistake DOJ squandered precious time to save lives—even taking days to isolate and test an inmate who was showing symptoms on March 22. https://t.co/by8D3D2Jqz

Thousands of families across America are feeling the impact of this pandemic even more because of their immigration status. That’s not right. Senator @MazieHirono and I introduced legislation to ensure immigrants aren’t left out of COVID-19 relief. https://t.co/ZnKQfiwUBF

More than 144000 Americans have died from COVID-19 and more than 4 million have been infected. In moments like these with so many lives upended we must remember to show love kindness and patience to one another.  Because that’s how we’ll get through this—together.

WATCH: My amendment creating a Racial and Ethnic Disparities Task Force has just passed the Homeland Security Committee. This is critical to addressing historic inequalities as we deal with COVID-19. https://t.co/RjGcLkOgd4

Many people of color don’t receive the same quality of health care as others and we cannot allow this to continue. Last week I announced a bill to support bias and anti-racism training for people involved in COVID-19 testing treatment vaccine distribution and response.
More than 140000 Americans have been killed by COVID-19 and Trump is actively fighting to block money for testing. This is dangerous and totally backwards. https://t.co/7li6ws4Ucv

Numbers don’t lie and this administration is desperately trying to hide the size of its failure to address this pandemic. We've just surpassed 3.5 million confirmed COVID-19 cases. The American public deserves transparency. https://t.co/rUYoZWhYP2

This week @RepAdams and I released a bill to support bias and anti-racism training for people involved in COVID-19 testing treatment vaccine distribution & response.  We’ve long known that people of color don't receive the same quality of health care as others. It has to stop.

I’m proud to announce my new bill to ensure Americans receive fair unbiased medical care as our country responds to COVID-19. Black folks have been hit hard by this pandemic—in part due to racial bias in our health care system.  We need to address that. https://t.co/9XkJ0Q8JKL

Coronavirus cases continue to spike across the country. There’s no excuse for the Senate to keep delaying more relief legislation. The House passed it almost two months ago—@senatemajldr we need to act immediately.

We have to stay vigilant this holiday weekend against the spread of COVID-19. No celebration is worth the risk to your life and that of your loved ones. Stay home if you can mask up and wash your hands.

The House passed additional COVID-19 relief on May 15 and the Senate still hasn’t voted on it. What are we waiting for Mitch McConnell? We are approaching 130000 American deaths. Our country needs us to act.

Californians: our state is seeing spikes of COVID-19 cases and we have to stay vigilant to prevent the spread of this virus. Please mask up stay at home if you can and continue practicing physical distancing.

10 million COVID-19 cases confirmed worldwide 2.6 million confirmed in the United States 126000 American deaths No leadership from the Trump administration  It's absurd that Senate GOP are holding up additional COVID-19 relief. The House passed a bill on May 15. We need to act.

It should not have taken a court order to release immigrant children in U.S. custody from detention because of COVID-19.  And I’ll say it again: ICE must also safely release their parents with them. https://t.co/oX4yVVsLxE

COVID-19 infections and hospitalizations are spiking across the country. 19.5 million Americans remain unemployed. And Senate Republicans are still focused on confirming judges instead of helping people through these crises.   I'm fed up—we need to pass more COVID-19 relief.

If Trump directed officials to “slow the testing down” for COVID-19 then we need to know about it.  So I'm asking officials one more time: has Trump or anyone at the White House pushed for COVID-19 resources to be used for political reasons—including by limiting testing?
The coronavirus pandemic is still ongoing and cases are on the rise across the country. Keep practicing physical distancing and for your safety and the safety of those around you please wear a mask.

Today the Senate did not vote on additional COVID-19 relief. We did not vote on oversight that this administration so desperately needs.  Instead we voted to advance a judicial nominee for a vacancy that doesn't even exist. It's just absurd. I voted NO. #StopWalker

Joining the National Urban League in a moment to talk about the work we’re doing in Congress to address the crises facing our nation today including police violence and the COVID-19 pandemic.  Tune in here. https://t.co/MW6YEYLhtf

.@RepKatiePorter and I refuse to let the Trump administration get away with hiding information on companies that received taxpayer funded COVID-19 relief.  We’re demanding nothing short of full transparency. https://t.co/rwdMMy1V2f

.@RepKatiePorter has been a tireless fighter for the people of California for as long as I’ve known her. I’m proud to work alongside her in Congress to ensure COVID-19 relief funds get to people who need it the most. https://t.co/2peE9xPbKj

Strong oversight of government's response to the COVID-19 pandemic requires an independent watchdog. Trump will do anything to escape accountability—so he tapped his lawyer Brian Miller to be Inspector General & sweep wrongdoing under the rug.  I voted NO today on his nomination.

100000+ American deaths from COVID-19. Countless fed up with ongoing police brutality. 40 million unemployed. No national testing strategy for the pandemic.  The lack of leadership on every one of these issues falls squarely on the occupant in the White House.

Why is it that Michael Cohen and Paul Manafort were granted release to home confinement while thousands of low-risk vulnerable inmates remain in prison where COVID-19 is spreading dangerously?  @RepJeffries and I are demanding answers. https://t.co/fGrai52kqo

The U.S. will soon reach 100000 deaths from COVID-19. That’s more than 40x the number of lives lost in the attack on Pearl Harbor.  We must remember that each death is one death too many. Every person lost is someone’s loved one a neighbor a friend.

Trump and members of Congress have put the AAPI community at risk by racializing COVID-19 as the “Chinese virus” and “Wuhan virus.” It’s on all of us to speak up report and condemn any racist attacks.  Read my op-ed with @RobBontaCA. #APAHM https://t.co/yAklQFApPI

Not only is COVID-19 disproportionately impacting Native communities but many health centers in these areas are at risk of closing down. That can’t happen especially during a pandemic.  I'm pushing for funding to save Native and Tribal health facilities. https://t.co/ELkarlnWAk

Being Trump’s former fixer shouldn’t get you special treatment in prison.  While Paul Manafort and Michael Cohen get released to home confinement thousands of low-risk vulnerable people remain in overcrowded prisons where COVID-19 continues to spread. https://t.co/z3MA0Z90Au

Leaders need to lead and that means we need ideas that rise to the level of this moment. I'm proud to cosponsor @SenBrianSchatz’s new bill to employ 1.5 million workers across the country to help states stop the spread of COVID-19 and reopen safety.

Astonishing. 38.6 million people have filed for unemployment in the past two months and yet Senate Republicans say there’s no urgency for additional COVID-19 relief.  Instead Mitch McConnell’s priority this week is confirming more judges. https://t.co/K8MgK6OWXn

Communities of color have far less access to trees & green spaces leading to more air pollution.  And this isn't a separate issue from the pandemic—air pollution is linked to higher COVID-19 deaths.  I introduced the Outdoors for All Act to help fix this. https://t.co/hFnazuL7JV

.@SenRonJohnson unilaterally decided to force a vote today on a purely political matter that has absolutely nothing to do with the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic. It’s completely unacceptable. https://t.co/JqCqo6R2Mg

Attorneys were calling for Choung Won Ahn's release from ICE custody in March. He was 74 with underlying health conditions and vulnerable to the spread of COVID-19.  He died by suicide on Sunday.  This tragedy was preventable. We need answers about the circumstances of his death. https://t.co/54NsCbUBv9

Instead of voting on additional COVID-19 relief that Americans desperately need Mitch McConnell’s priority in the Senate this week is confirming more lifetime judicial appointments. It’s beyond ridiculous.

I’m calling for a Judiciary Committee hearing on the spread of COVID-19 in prisons because we need to hold leaders accountable for failing to prepare for the virus. I raised the alarm months ago that they needed to prepare. There’s no excuse.

Even as we approach 90000 American deaths from COVID-19 Trump is still doing everything he can to punish career public servants in charge of holding his lawless administration accountable.  Congress must investigate this. https://t.co/l6BPsRmyr3

The racist attacks against Asians Asian-Americans and the broader AAPI community during the COVID-19 pandemic are sickening. There is no place for hate and discrimination in America.  Proud to lead a resolution with @SenDuckworth and @maziehirono  to condemn these attacks.

This is what privilege looks like. For months I've been pushing DOJ to release certain low-risk and vulnerable people to prevent the spread of COVID-19—including the elderly and pregnant women.  Instead Trump's friend gets released to home confinement. https://t.co/8Dm59uVJPQ

We need a Judiciary Committee hearing on the spread of COVID-19 in our prisons.  I raised the alarm in March that the Justice Department and Bureau of Prisons needed to prepare for COVID-19. They did not do that. And it's on us to hold Bill Barr’s DOJ accountable.

Pay attention to this. We cannot overlook the disproportionate impact coronavirus is having on Native communities. That's why I'm leading my colleagues in a push to save Tribal and Urban Indian Health Facilities. https://t.co/OZjzxEAdk2

Now at least 6 inmates have died from COVID-19 and 60% have tested positive. I raised the alarm MONTHS ago on the danger of COVID-19 in these facilities. It's unacceptable.  So today I spoke with the warden at Terminal Island to push for releases—because people are dying.

THREAD—let's talk about what's happening at Terminal Island prison.  On March 5 I was the first senator to demand the Bureau of Prisons prepare for COVID-19. Then on April 2 I called on Terminal Island prison to lay out their plan to prepare for COVID-19.  Neither happened.

Trump is questioning the accuracy of the COVID-19 death toll because it ultimately highlights his failure of leadership during this pandemic. The American people deserve better than this.  I'm pushing FEMA and HHS to ensure an accurate death toll. https://t.co/IlD0YSuCmf

Carlos's death was likely preventable. My heart goes out to his family.  For months I have called on DHS and BOP to act quickly to prevent the spread of COVID-19 at facilities like Otay Mesa Detention Center. They must take every step available to prevent more illness and loss. https://t.co/iGtfFWQaAV

I'm leading my colleagues in a push to save Native and Tribal health facilities. We're in the middle of a pandemic and we can’t let these facilities close down while these communities are disproportionately impacted by COVID-19. https://t.co/FiChvc4Bpk

Yesterday I led more than 50 of my colleagues in a push for more funds for Tribal and Urban Indian Health Facilities.  Our Tribal and Native communities are disproportionately impacted by COVID-19 and these health facilities are in danger of closing. We can't let that happen.

My question to Rep. Ratcliffe in his confirmation hearing today to be the next DNI: do you believe Trump has accurately conveyed the severity of the threat of COVID-19 to the American people?   He said "I believe so." But the facts say otherwise. https://t.co/H2eYnIQJF0

Here's how likely minority-owned businesses are to be DENIED from PPP loans:  Black-owned: 95% Latino-owned: 91% Native Hawaiian or Pacific Islander-owned: 91% Asian-owned: 75%  This is not what an equitable COVID-19 response looks like. I'm working to fix it.

I said it after Hurricane Maria and I’m saying it now: we need an accurate death count. It's critical to understanding COVID-19's impact.  In 2018 I passed a bill to study and ensure this—but until that study is finished FEMA needs to establish protocols for this pandemic now.

A new study found that unless we reduce the number of detained people in ICE detention centers up to 100% of immigrants in custody could contract COVID-19 within 90 days. 100%.   DHS needs to prioritize the release of low-risk and vulnerable people—immediately.

My new bill would create a COVID-19 Racial and Ethnic Disparities Task Force because this pandemic is highlighting deep racial disparities that have long existed in our country—and we need to act. https://t.co/rya5AePPlX

Otay Mesa has the most COVID-19 cases of any ICE detention facility. That's why I called for an investigation into the treatment of people held there.  There's no question that low-risk and vulnerable detained persons need to be safely released to prevent the spread of the virus. https://t.co/PUxoOj7Gty

This #MayDay and every day I'm thinking about our essential workers who are working tirelessly to get us through this pandemic. We must do more to support them.  That means hazard pay paid leave and free COVID-19 tests and treatment regardless of their immigration status.

Andrea Circle Bear is the first woman to die in federal prison from COVID-19. She was pregnant and her baby survived after being delivered by C-section. My heart is with her family and loved ones.  During the pandemic DOJ must release more pregnant women to home confinement. https://t.co/4J9BfZxETy

What is happening at Terminal Island prison is a public health crisis. More than half of the 1055 inmates have tested positive for COVID-19. 4 have died.  DOJ must step in to protect staff and inmates and immediately release certain low-risk offenders. https://t.co/1kLlRNXQ4j

Reminder that Mitch McConnell is bringing the Senate back into session next week with nothing on the schedule to address the coronavirus crisis. Instead he wants to confirm more judges. In the middle of a pandemic.

Today I'm announcing my new bill to create a COVID-19 Racial and Ethnic Disparities Task Force.  We need a serious targeted effort to address the reality that Black and brown people are disproportionately being infected and dying from COVID-19 across the nation. https://t.co/AdFosf2yi4

We cannot praise the essential work of our immigrant community while continuing to shut so many of them out of coronavirus relief.  One thing I'm pushing for: ensuring everyone regardless of their immigration status has access to free testing and free treatment for COVID-19. https://t.co/A2ScRlM459

This is an outrage. More than 55000 Americans have died from coronavirus and Senate Republicans still want to prioritize stacking our courts with ideologues. We won’t stand for this. https://t.co/04xpBJZZxe

We need to know whether politics has played a role in the Trump administration's COVID-19 response and distribution of critical resources.  Last week my colleagues and I sent a letter to HHS and FEMA's Inspectors General demanding broad investigations.

Now is not the time to be giving away money to a small group of wealthy Americans. It's outrageous that Senate Republicans continue to support a tax break for this group as part of COVID-19 relief.  I cosponsored a bill last week to repeal the tax giveaway.
I can't believe this needs to be said but please do not ingest any kind of disinfectant. It will not kill the coronavirus. Trump is spreading dangerous misinformation and endangering lives.

Marijuana small businesses employ more than 240000 workers and should be allowed to access coronavirus relief funds too. My colleagues and I are pushing to ensure they’re not left out of Congress’s next relief package.

At least 40 immigrant children in US custody have contracted coronavirus and that number is likely to rise. It's our moral obligation to protect their health and safety first.  Today @RepEscobar and I are demanding the safe release of nearly 2400 detained immigrant children.

Wildfire and hurricane season is approaching & we will be tested in unprecedented ways because of the ongoing pandemic. FEMA must have a plan.  I just led 80 members of Congress in a letter to FEMA demanding they outline natural disaster preparation & recovery plans for COVID-19.

This pandemic isn’t close to being over and yet the authorization for National Guard troops on the frontlines of responding to COVID-19 will soon expire. We need them to continue the fight in California and around the country.  I’m demanding Trump extend the authorization.

This virus impacts everyone—it doesn't care about race ethnicity or immigration status. And that means vital COVID-19 resources must be available regardless of immigration status.  Our bill would ensure immigrants aren't left out of critical coronavirus relief resources. https://t.co/Z7YVEsy6Vh

Last week I announced my new bill to provide $5 billion to ensure our elections are safe and accessible during the coronavirus pandemic. The right to vote is fundamental—we must protect it. https://t.co/KBmvkzsEUE

Trump said last month that anyone who wants a test for COVID-19 can get one. That's not true—there still aren’t nearly enough tests.   The American people need Trump to show leadership and ensure we produce the tests and supplies to adequately combat this crisis.

Coronavirus doesn’t care about race political party or immigration status. Yet in the middle of a pandemic Otay Mesa Detention Center personnel reportedly withheld face masks until immigrant detainees signed waivers.   Unacceptable. I'm demanding an investigation. https://t.co/DGGb4PkpyI
Every person across the country regardless of their immigration status should have access to free testing and free treatment for COVID-19.

I've been pushing for racial data on COVID-19 and I'm glad to see that the CDC has released some of this information. But we need to do more.   People of color are disproportionately suffering from this pandemic. Congressional leaders must prioritize this disparity. https://t.co/rW6Df6oKwc

Black communities are disproportionately suffering from COVID-19. Unfortunately this news didn’t come as a surprise to me or anyone familiar with our country’s shameful legacy of racial inequality.   Read my op-ed. https://t.co/97Opr9C3aQ

Today I'm demanding an investigation into the treatment of people held at Otay Mesa Detention Center. Otay Mesa has the most COVID-19 cases of any ICE immigration detention facility and DHS isn't doing enough to prevent inhumane conditions.  We need answers and accountability.

Coronavirus appears to be disproportionately killing people of color and Congress needs to wake up and address this injustice. Today I'm pushing Senate leadership to prioritize funding to combat racial health disparities in COVID-19 testing and outcomes.

Black Americans are infected and dying from COVID-19 at alarming rates and we need demographic data to understand the full scope of the issue.  Proud to join my colleagues on a bill today to require the federal government to collect and report this data.
Racial disparities in health care existed long before the coronavirus pandemic—especially when it comes to the maternal health of Black women. https://t.co/OaufZFMgOS

Too many minority-owned businesses are being left out of coronavirus relief programs. And the truth is that our neighborhoods won't look the same without these businesses.  The administration must do more to prioritize relief for them. https://t.co/VbqZ8Qobe7

COVID-19 doesn't care about the party with which you're registered to vote. Congress needs to come together to pass additional relief. That has to include:  -free coronavirus treatment -more support for small businesses -paid sick leave for all and more. https://t.co/VxnPD7McfJ

The past two months have made clear that the federal government was unprepared to confront the coronavirus pandemic. I'm proud to help introduce this bill to ensure these mistakes don’t happen again. https://t.co/b3sOhGswh5

The Otay Mesa immigration detention center in San Diego now has the most COVID-19 cases of any detention facility. DHS has failed to take sufficient action to protect vulnerable people in these facilities. That needs to change—now. https://t.co/Wt3Hx5fVrP

The coronavirus pandemic is highlighting long-existing racial disparities in our health care system that Black communities know all too well. As we begin Black Maternal Health Week we must also speak truth about the crisis afflicting Black mothers and babies. https://t.co/BiAWeLprtm

I stand with the fast food workers across California today protesting insufficient protections against COVID-19. They are putting their lives at risk to keep these businesses running and deserve hazard pay protective equipment paid sick leave and more. https://t.co/6eNBEHaKto

Farm workers have always been essential and it's long past time they received the protections they deserve. That includes ensuring these workers who put food on our tables have access to COVID-19 testing treatment and so much more. https://t.co/F82sPr2hfJ
Confronting the racial disparities in COVID-19 cases and deaths means speaking truth about historic inequalities impacting vulnerable people in particular Black communities. https://t.co/5T0KlxP5xm

Earlier today Trump removed the lead Inspector General charged with monitoring how the administration spends $2 trillion in COVID-19 relief.  This is yet another deeply troubling example of Trump and his administration attempting to evade accountability. We won't stand for it. https://t.co/MITRK7P9ls

Early reports indicate that Black Americans are dying at alarming rates from COVID-19. This is why I called on HHS to collect and report demographic data on testing treatment and fatalities across the country. We need to confront this reality now. https://t.co/M2d1XvyjJO

Thousands of people are sitting in jails right now facing serious illness or death from COVID-19 simply because they can't afford to make bail. I applaud California for taking this step—we need it nationwide. https://t.co/xLy8JfDm8j

Native American communities in rural areas are especially vulnerable to the spread of coronavirus and yet their needs are still not being prioritized. We need significant investments in tribal and native communities now more than ever. https://t.co/wr6uD7sg7v
